body_html: 6 months ago there was no plan on the horizon to get rid of the 2GB limit (it would require deep changes to protobuf library) .... but perhaps you can make your graph smaller? IE, you can use distributed tensorflow locally where each worker holds only part of graph relevant to it. Alternatively, you can use function.Defun to factor out large repeating chunks of your computation.

body: 6 months ago there was no plan on the horizon to get rid of the 2GB limit (it would require deep changes to protobuf library) .... but perhaps you can make your graph smaller? IE, you can use distributed tensorflow locally where each worker holds only part of graph relevant to it. Alternatively, you can use `function.Defun` to factor out large repeating chunks of your computation.
